intro: Luehea microcarpa var. polymorpha, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a flowering plant species native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive red bark and its ability to thrive in saline and tidal environments. The plant has small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species. This variant is notable for its adaptability to harsh coastal conditions and its unique morphological features.
